text: Arkle Town is a hamlet adjoining Langthwaite in Arkengarthdale in the Richmondshire district of, North Yorkshire, England. Arkel is a Norse personal name and probably arrived with settlers during the tenth century.Batty, Margaret (1982) A View of Akengarthdale. Teesdale Mercury Press. Page 4. Formerly it had a parish church, inn and workhouse. Now there are none of these though the graveyard can still be traced. The 1851 census counted 41 houses in Arkle Town.Batty. pp 14. ==References== ==External links== Category:Villages in North Yorkshire Category:Arkengarthdale
title: Arkle Town
